com.intel.fightclub.dialog.tokens

Class SpeechToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.tokens.CuiToken
      • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.tokens.SpeechToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExpirationToken

    @NotThreadSafe
public final class SpeechToken
extends CuiToken
    Implementation which handles the start of speech timeout. This is not a thread safe class and the expiration event runs on the thread that instantiated this class.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveLpalTimeMillis

        public long retrieveLpalTimeMillis()
        Returns:
        The saved LPAL time in milliseconds or a value less than 0 if no LPAL time was saved.

      • saveLpalTimeMillis

        public void saveLpalTimeMillis(long lpalTimeMillis)
        Saves an LPAL expiration time.
        Parameters:
        lpalTimeMillis - The LPAL expiration time in milliseconds.

      • expire

        public void expire(boolean notify)
        Description copied from class: CuiToken

        >Explicitly expire the token.

        Subclass implementations should call this superclass method to notify listeners that the token has been expired. Otherwise, listeners will not be notified.

        Specified by:
        expire in interface ExpirationToken
        Overrides:
        expire in class CuiToken
        Parameters:
        notify - If true, the registered ExpirationListener's onExpired method will be called.

      • getRemainingTimeMillis

        public long getRemainingTimeMillis()
        Returns:
        The remaining time (in milliseconds) before this token will expire.

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        Returns:
        True if the token has expired and false otherwise.

      • renew

        public boolean renew()
        Description copied from interface: ExpirationToken
        Renews the token thus extending its lifetime. If the token is expired, then this method should un-expire the token and restart the timeout.
        Returns:
        True if the token was successfully renewed and the timer was reset accordingly.

      • renew

        public boolean renew(long newTimeoutMillis)

        This renews the timeout. If newTimeoutMillis is less than 0, then the existing adapted timeout will be modified if applicable. If it is greater than or equal to 0, then the provided time will be used as the adapted timeout.

        Additionally, if you are getting a brand new start of speech event, then the reset() method should be called first.

        Parameters:
        newTimeoutMillis - The expiration time (in milliseconds) to use.
        Returns:
        True if the token was successfully renewed and the timer was reset accordingly.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: ExpirationToken
        Resets the token to its original state. This is the equivalent of creating a new token instance.

      • doExecuteOnExpiredByTimeout

        protected void doExecuteOnExpiredByTimeout()
        Description copied from class: CuiToken
        This is executed when the token expires due to timeout. This will be executed prior to the ExpirationListener callback being invoked.
        Specified by:
        doExecuteOnExpiredByTimeout in class CuiToken
